data.title: Covid-19: from ticking time bomb to mild inconvenience
data.description: A leading virologist weighs in on the discussion of whether all those prevention measures and the push to get vaccinated were over the top

data.title: Paetongtarn, officials join boat tour celebrating Chao Phraya River
data.description: Vijit Chao Phraya event runs daily until December 15 as part of Thailand Winter Festival

data.title: Mitr Phol Wins Human Rights Award for 5th Year
data.description: Mitr Phol Group, a global leader in sustainability within the food products industry, has been honoured with the prestigious "Human Rights Award 2024" for the fifth consecutive year. The award was presented by the Rights and Liberties Protection Department, Ministry of Justice, at a ceremony held at the Miracle Grand Convention Hotel, Bangkok, on 2 December 2024. Representing the company, Mr Kitjapat Trakulmaykee, Executive Vice President of the Human Resources Group, received the accolade from Pol. Col. Tawee Sodsong, Minister of Justice.

data.title: ICONSIAM Welcomes 2025 with Global Countdown Spectacle
data.description: ICONSIAM is gearing up to host the  Amazing Thailand Countdown 2025 , a three-day extravaganza that promises to be a world-class celebration like no other. From December 29 to 31, 2024, over 60 celebrities will take the stage, delivering unforgettable performances that blend Thai cultural brilliance with global entertainment excellence.

data.title: Orient Showcases 'Made in Thailand' Success at EPSON Factory
data.description: Showcasing the perfect blend of Japanese precision and Thai craftsmanship, Orient celebrated the success of its "Made in Thailand" initiative with a special event at the EPSON Thailand (EPTH) factory in Chachoengsao province on November 28, 2024. The gathering brought together key executives, media representatives, and partners to highlight Thailand’s pivotal role in the brand’s global watch production under the Orient and Orient Star banners.

data.title: Suspect held in slaying of US insurance CEO
data.description: ALTOONA, Pennsylvania - New York prosecutors have filed a murder charge against the suspect in the killing of a health insurance executive, a brazen shooting that set off a tense five-day manhunt that culminated in his capture in Pennsylvania on Monday.

data.title: Teacher gets 111 years for sexually abusing hundreds of children
data.description: DSI reveals suspect conspired with model agency owner to abuse up to 1,000 minors, recording the crimes in over half a million images

data.title: Father of Chon Buri MP  shot, severely wounded
data.description: CHON BURI - Sakda Noppasit, father  of People

data.title: Thailand’s debt relief plan heads to Cabinet
data.description: Packages will waive interest on NPLs and forgive debt on credit-card and personal loans of less than 5,000 baht

data.description: Art lovers are invited to explore the liminal space between paintings and sculptures during "(Brackets)" which is running at SAC Gallery until Jan 11.

data.title: Thai government poised to forgive credit-card and personal loans of up to 5,000 baht as debt crisis spirals
data.description: Pichai highlights risks and opportunities in upcoming US trade talks set for February

data.title: Toxic gas killed men in fish fermentation tank
data.description: PHETCHABUN - Police believe a build up of toxic gas in a fish fermentation tank is what probably killed the five men who were assigned to clean it at a  pla-ra plant in this northern province on Monday evening.

data.title: An exquisite Christmas at InterContinental Bangkok
data.description: Festive afternoon tea, sumptuous meals, and the joy of gift-giving—there are countless ways to celebrate the most wonderful time of the year. Honouring traditions from California to Cantonese, InterContinental Bangkok, recognised as one of Southeast Asia’s Best Hotels in the 2024 Condé Nast Traveller Readers’ Choice Awards UK and a Michelin Guide Key Hotel, embraces the spirit of Christmas with an array of luxurious experiences to share with friends and family.

data.title: OR focused on sustainability as CEO hands over reins
data.description: Disathat Panyarachun signs off by underscoring energy & retail giant’s drive for efficiency, innovation and results

data.title: InterContinental Bangkok celebrates New Year’s with sensational style
data.description: InterContinental Bangkok, recognised as one of the Best Hotels in Southeast Asia at the 2024 Condé Nast Traveller Readers’ Choice Awards UK and a Michelin Guide Key Hotel, stands as the ultimate year-end celebration destination in the heart of Bangkok. Revellers can indulge in a curated collection of experiences, from multi-course fine dining to poolside parties beneath a sky ablaze with fireworks.

data.title: One in a million stars
data.description: Though Asian-American hip-hop artist Star2 is based in San Diego, California, his roots belong in Asia.

data.title: GPSC eyes investing in small nuclear reactors
data.description: PTT subsidiary sets out to generate electricity through renewables as it aims to achieve net zero by 2060

data.title: Mystery surrounds deaths of five workers at Phetchabun factory
data.description: Cause of death of workers at fermented fish factory will be determined at autopsy, local police chief says

data.title: The ultimate pre-Christmas treats!
data.description: It’s that time of the year again, when festive afternoon teas are being rolled out to ensure we get ourselves into the mood for Christmas. Guru picks our top twelve, in no particular order.

data.title: Massacre in Haiti leaves nearly 200 dead
data.description: PORT-AU-PRINCE — More than 180 people were killed in a massacre over the weekend in one of the poorest neighbourhoods of Haiti’s capital, the United Nations (UN) human rights chief said Monday.

data.title: Cambodian trainee to sue farm manager in Japan over repeated rapes
data.description: KYODO — A Cambodian woman who worked as a technical trainee at a strawberry farm north of Tokyo plans to file a damages suit against the farm manager, alleging multiple instances of rape that led to pregnancy and abortion, her lawyer said Monday.

data.title: VASMO to set up Chemical Metal Compound plant
data.description: GC Estate Co., Ltd. (GC Estate), a subsidiary of GC Group specialising in utilities and land leasing and sales has signed a land lease agreement for a 60-rai plot in the Asia Industrial Estate, Rayong province, with VASMO Co., Ltd. (VASMO). The agreement facilitates the construction of Thailand’s first chemical metal compound and alloy manufacturing plant utilising decommissioned and unused catalysts from the oil refining and petrochemical industries.

data.title: Former Pheu Thai spokesman critical after shooting
data.description: Sakda Noppasith, 61, is in a critical after being shot in the early hours of Tuesday morning at a Chonburi restaurant

data.title: Taiwan reports surge of Chinese military aircraft, ships operating nearby
data.description: TAIPEI — Taiwan

data.title: Government vows stronger fight against corruption
data.description: The government has vowed to be proactive in addressing  corruption  in a bid to raise Thailand’s Corruption Perceptions Index (CPI) score from 35 to over  50 out of 100 .

data.title: AMCHAM hosts Minister of Commerce for Member Luncheon
data.description: The American Chamber of Commerce in Thailand (AMCHAM) welcomed Pichai Naripthaphan, Minister of Commerce, as the honoured guest at its Member Luncheon, where he shared insights into Thailand's trade and economic strategy.

data.title: 52-year-old man from S’pore dies after getting a massage in Phuket
data.description: A man from Singapore died after a visit to a massage parlour in Phuket on Dec 7.

data.title: AMCHAM Hosts Minister of Commerce H.E. Pichai Naripthaphan for Member Luncheon
data.description: Bangkok, December 9, 2024 – The American Chamber of Commerce in Thailand (AMCHAM) welcomed H.E. Pichai Naripthaphan, Minister of Commerce, as the honoured guest at its Member Luncheon, where he shared insights into Thailand's trade and economic strategy.

data.description: A man from Singapore died after a visit to a massage parlour in Phuket on Dec 7.

data.title: Two former Syrian intelligence officials face US war crimes charges
data.description: WASHINGTON: A US indictment unsealed on Monday charged two former high-ranking Syrian officials under ousted President Bashar al-Assad with war crimes, the US Justice Department said in a statement.

data.title: Visit Uzbekistan with Siam Society
data.description: Siam Society is holding a study trip to Uzbekistan, a fascinating country in Central Asia, from March 14-23.

data.title: Thoughts turn to dust
data.description: Since the expansion of corn cultivation for animal feed in the region, Thailand, Myanmar and Laos have been negatively impacted by the increasing severity of PM2.5 pollution in the northern region.

data.title: Remembering J-pop star Miporin, found dead at 54
data.description: Miho Nakayama, the celebrated Japanese actress and singer renowned for her iconic performance in the 1995 romantic masterpiece Love Letter, has passed away at the age of 54. Her body was discovered at her home in Tokyo

data.title: War Elephants in Group D for Asian Cup qualifiers
data.description: Thailand were drawn in Group D with Turkmenistan, Taiwan and Sri Lanka for the 2027  AFC Asian Cup , which will be staged in Saudi Arabia.

data.title: Goals galore as Thailand rout Timor
data.description: Reigning champions Thailand, aiming to win an unprecedented third title in a row, made their intentions clear on Sunday night when they began their Asean Mitsubishi Electric Cup 2024 campaign with a 10-0 hammering of Timor Leste at Hang Day Stadium.

data.title: Southern alert sounds over more expected rain misery
data.description: The Operation Centre for Flood and Landslide Victims has warned authorities and residents to prepare for new downpours in the southern region, already battered by widespread  flooding .

data.title: UN envoy urges soil, water action
data.description: The United Nations Special Envoy on Water has said constructive action to ensure sustainable soil and water management should be a high political priority for all member states.

data.title: Crew's release awaits Myanmar nod
data.description: The government will have to wait for Nay Pyi Taw to decide on the fate of the Thai crewmembers detained in the neighbouring country following an incident off the coast of Ranong last week, as local authorities are not authorised to sign off on their release.
